instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: Hello. Got this board here. UB300 was boiling hot, so I replaced it. When I removed the chip PAD number 4 was ripped off, so I ran a jumper wire through it. Some other pads have been ripped, they are 7 and 8, but no big deal, since pins 6 and 18 which are connected to them are integer and conducting well. No I get 5V on all ports, but all of them except the one I replaced UB300 is drawing around 250mA from charger. UB300 negotiates 5V but draws 0A from charger. I have no visible blown components and no shorts I could find. Any ideas?

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message:
Compare diode mode readings between UB300 and other chips.
Can have bad solders, or bad/fake chip; if bought "new" from China.

BTW, can you put the machine in DFU mode?

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: If tested on each respective fuse, all of them give 0.168 on diode mode. Machine enter DFU, but does not complete restore.

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message:
I gave some reflows to UB300 and now all ports behave the same. 250mA power consumption with 5V. I noticed something strange... 
PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOA is giving me 3.3V instead of 1.8V

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: Check if not shorted to  PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDOA, u otra barra de 3V.

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: Cannot find any 3v3 lines shorted to 1v8

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: Then UB300 is bad...

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: Replaced UB300 AGAIN from donor board. Still same thing... It's not possible I got 3 CD3215 with literally the SAME defect. The strangest thing is that UB300 corresponding port communicates with charger and requests 5V but if I reverse the cable it does not negotiate anything with charger. I don't know what to do anymore.

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: Then you have a problem with CC1/2 lines on that port.

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: I noticed something strange here. All ports, except for the UB300 port read the same on CC1/2 respective lines, which is around 1.6V on their respective RB. For example, on RB650 I get 1.6V and RB660 0V, when I reverse the cable, RB650 gets 0V and RB600 gets 1.6V. On RB640 and RB630 on the other hand, I get 5V on RB640 and 1.6V on RB630 and reversing the cable I get 0V on both. I think the problem may be there.

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message:
You may have bad UB300 , or problem on the corresponding USB-C terminals.
Remove the USB-C port from shell and inspect the terminals.

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: All terminals are good, already inspected them... But this is the third or fourth UB300 I put on the board... Tried with new and donor ones... All behave the same

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: Also tried replacing some diodes, same result

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message:
Shouldn't ever have 5V on RB640.
Change QB640, it may leaks through Gate from PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: Replaced it, same

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: Remove RB640 and check which pins get 5V then.

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: It's on PIN 1

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: Then it comes from USB-C connector.

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: Yes, and that's what's strangest LOL

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: What would you suggest then? I'm out of ideas already... Thinking about throwing this piece of shit on the litter bin.

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: Did you try another charger, another cable?

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: Yes, 2 different original chargers, one 96W, another 61W, 2 original Apple cables, one USB-C USB-C another Thunderbolt 3 Thunderbolt 3. All give same results. Also, machine enters DFU state, but does not complete restore. T2 gets a little warm.

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: Also tried with different USB-C ports

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message:
You probably have damaged traces on internal copper layer, underneath UB300.

All AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages must be present and stable, for DFU to work.
SSD voltages must also be there; or come on at least after DFU revive.

threads.title: 820-00850 5V On Charger
threads.message: Agreed. Gave up on this one. Already told the costumer. Thanks for the help. Topic closed, unsolved.
